intro: Chorizanthe uncinata, commonly known as the hooked choris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Chorizanthe uncinata is adapted to withstand drought and is often seen in disturbed or open habitats.
